WEB DESIGNER         Professional Summary     Trained Quality Assurance Specialist with a demonstrated history of working in the pharmaceuticals industry. Skilled in Risk Assessment, Regulatory summary writings, Documentation, Quality Assurance, Quality System, and Data Analysis. Strong quality assurance professional with a Masters in Computer Science and Bachelors in Electronics.       Skills                    Work History      Web designer  ,      and Database designer: One Plus, Glasgow, UK.  Web designer: Nuclear disarmament, Glasgow.  UK.  Office assistant: Iona community.  Glasgow, UK.  Polling Clark in a Scottish parliament election (2004) Care Assistant in BUPA care home, Glasgow.  Specific skills: Langages: C & C# Data base: ORACLE, SQL Web Technologies:  ASP.NET, HTML5, CSS3, Dream weaver.         Currently Quality specialist  ,     07/2015   to   Current       City        Preparation of the Elemental impurity Risk reports for drug products and API Experienced in developing risk analysis model and conducting thorough risk assessment starting from the basic till final report Generating regulatory summary for all the approved elemental impurities reports (US and Canada) Collaborate globally and cross functionally (in CFTs) with in varying sites to complete complex project goals.  Sites: Ludwigshafen, Sligo, Cork, AP16, Puerto Rico, and Campoverde.(e.g.  gluten, elemental impurities, and API metal catalysts) Author, co-author and verify multiple risk control assessments pertaining to elemental impurities, gluten, and metal catalyst used in AbbVie drug products & API.  In-depth understanding of ICH Q3D, EMA, Pharm Eur, USP, and Gluten-FDA in relation to Abbvie drug products.  Assist compendial services with heavy metal deletion project in relation to Abbvie API's Proficient in MS Word, Excel, Adobe Acrobat, power point, Visio, and other commonly used software. Weekly Updation of the site with all the details of major events.  Uploaded files and photographs of research works.  The website has an user friendly interface which even helps everybody to have a clear idea about IBTN. Duties: Data monitoring and analysis, recording and updating data base of sterilisation equipments, working as a group, work management Responsible for correct assembly , checking, packing and marking of all items prior to sterilisation The operation of a range of decontamination equipment and performance of routine user tests.  Inputting records and data required for the operation of the sterile services quality system.  Maintaining all the records, archives and IT system needed for the quality standard and traceability of the instrumentation. story:
Here's your candidate's story:

Meet a fascinating professional who's journeyed from electronics to web design and ultimately found their niche in pharmaceutical quality assurance. Their story begins in India, where they earned a Bachelor's in Electronics from Mahatma Gandhi University, followed by a Masters in Computer Applications from Bangalore University. During their academic years, they developed an impressive array of technical skills, working on everything from airline reservation systems to chemical reactor simulations.

Their career took an interesting turn when they moved to Glasgow, UK. There, they wore many hats - from being a Web Designer at One Plus to working as a Polling Clark in the Scottish parliament election. They even spent time as a Care Assistant at BUPA care home, showing their versatility and human touch. A particularly noteworthy role was their position as an Assistant Technical Officer at South Glasgow NHS Trust, where they managed sterilization equipment and quality systems.

The story gets even more interesting in 2014 when they became the webmaster for the IBTN research group at UIC, developing and maintaining their official website. But the most significant chapter began in 2015 when they found their calling in pharmaceutical quality assurance. Currently, they're a Quality Specialist working with global teams across multiple sites, from Ludwigshafen to Puerto Rico. They've become an expert in elemental impurity risk assessment and regulatory compliance, collaborating with teams worldwide.

Their toolkit is impressive: they're fluent in multiple programming languages (C, C#), comfortable with database systems (ORACLE, SQL), and skilled in web technologies (ASP.NET, HTML5, CSS3). This unique combination of technical expertise and quality assurance knowledge makes them a valuable asset in the pharmaceutical industry.

Their journey represents a remarkable evolution from a technically-focused professional to a quality assurance specialist who brings both technical precision and regulatory understanding to their work. They've successfully bridged the gap between IT and pharmaceuticals, creating a unique professional identity along the way.
